org.divxdede.swing.busy

Class BusySwingWorker<T,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<T,V>
      • org.divxdede.swing.busy.BusySwingWorker<T,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, Future<T>, RunnableFuture<T>

    public abstract class BusySwingWorker<T,V>
extends SwingWorker<T,V>
    A SwingWorker providing a BusyModel for disable components while this worker is running.

    The BusyModel's state reflet changes mades on this worker.

    When this SwingWorker start, the BusyModel gone to busy.
    When this SwingWorker's end, the BusyModel gone to idle.
    If this SwingWorker use it's SwingWorker.setProgress(int) method to indicate the progression of it's task, the BusyModel will be automatically determinate.
    In the counterpart, if the BusyModel is cancellable, cancel the BusyModel will cancel also the SwingWorker.

    You can use the getProgressModel() for updating the progression of this worker with your own value range (you must define BoundedRangeModel.getMinimum() and BoundedRangeModel.getMaximum()).
    The underlying BoundedRangeModel call the SwingWorker.setProgress(int) with the value automatically scale to the [0 ~ 100] range.

    Since:
    1.2.2
    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede)

    • Method Detail

      • getBusyModel

        public final BusyModel getBusyModel()
        Return the @{link BusyModel} that allow to disable a component or a container while this SwingWorker is running.
        You can set this BusyModel to a JBusyComponent that will define which component or container (view) to disable.
        Returns:
        BusyModel handled by this SwingWorker

      • setBusyModel

        public final void setBusyModel(BusyModel model)
        Define the @{link BusyModel} that allow to disable a component or a container while this SwingWorker is running.
        Parameters:
        model - to handle by this SwingWorker

      • getProgressModel

        public BoundedRangeModel getProgressModel()
        Return a BoundedRangeModel that can be used to set the progression of this worker.
        This tool facilite the way to set the progression without the restriction of a range [0 ~ 100].

        You can define a user-range for the progression. Each changes made on the model will be set on the worker by calling SwingWorker.setProgress(int)

        Returns:
        A usable BoundedRangeModel for set the progression
